source: Beneﬁcios de tener una cuenta en una institución ﬁnanciera: evita que cargue efectivo; gasta solo lo que tiene; realiza las compras sin costo extra; puede retirar efectivo en cajeros automáticos o supermercados; puedes llevar una mejor administración del dinero.

That makes sense because some banks charge fees when you get a cash advance from an ATM or something similar. Next, there's "gasta solo lo que tiene," meaning only spend what you have. This suggests that with a bank account, you can manage your expenses better by not overspending since you're using your own money instead of credit. Then we have "realiza las compras sin costo extra." So, making purchases without additional costs implies that things like debit transactions might be cheaper than using a credit card where interest rates apply. "Retirar efectivo en cajeros automáticos o supermercados" translates to withdrawing cash at ATMs or supermarkets. This shows convenience, as people don't have to go to a physical branch necessarily but can access their funds easily. Lastly, "puedes llevar una mejor administración del dinero" means you can have better money management. Managing all finances under one place probably helps track income and expenses more effectively.
ref_Annette: Beneﬁcios de tener una cuenta en una Institución ﬁnanciera. Evita que cargue efectivo, gasta solo lo que tiene, realiza las compras sin costo extra, puede retirar efectivo en cajeros automáticos o supermercados, puede llevar una mejor administración del dinero.
